description.narrative: KADDRO is working in Kambia District in 3 chiefdoms (Masungbala, Gbinleh and Dixon) supporting poor and vulnerable rural women and youths in sustainable livelihood support. One of the components in the sustainable livelihood support is the establishment of Village Savings and Loan Associations (VSLAs) which encourage village/community people to be able to save and invest from their own production. However, this was challenged with high illiteracy rate and absence of financial institutions to make available their financial products and services to the grassroots population or community level outside the district headquarter town. At the moment, Kambia has only one Bank, three Micro credit organisations at the district headquarter town and seven Financial Services institutions spread in the chiefdom headquarter towns provided by IFAD. KADDRO intends to tap from knowledge, skills and human resources these institutions have to provide and or extend their financial services and or products to community/grassroots level. KADDRO intends to deepen knowledge through sensitization and education around financial inclusion at all levels (community, section, chiefdom and district levels). At the same time, the project will utilize creative approaches to strengthen linkages between VSLAs and financial institutions that will provide benefits for all stakeholders involved.
